channel.title: Cloverfield
channel.description:
Well the idea of filming through the camera of the people in the crisis was a pretty cool idea, but this movie was hard to watch on the big screen. The movie runs for about an hour and 20 minutes, most of this is through the shaking hands of Hud. Imagine spinning around on a tire swing for that length of time, full out spinning but stopping every 10 or so minutes for about 20 seconds, then starting again. I felt sick, my friends felt sick, most people there felt sick.
Now for the plot of Cloverfield...To tell you the truth, I didn't really feel that there was a plot. Sure stuff was happening, but it all seemed kind of random at the time. He died, she died. Smashed this shit, wish I was smashed instead. Boy loves girl, etc and I happened to miss the most exciting part of the movie, but I did catch the last bit of that part and it wasn't all [i]that[/i] exciting which can say quite a bit about the movie.
If it was on a TV at home the filming would be fine as there is still objects everywhere, but the big screen hurt. I have a feeling I wasn't all that impressed just because I felt sick. Still go see it as I did enjoy it in the end, but prepare for that gut feeling.
I give it a 7/10
-Mh

@diamond1 wrote:

i threw up. this movie is the worst movie ive EVER seen. imo. waste of time/money. 2/10

item.title: Cloverfield
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“shpoanator, post:19, topic:174528”]2. I don’t know much about helicopters but I think after the beating they all went through they wouldn’t be able to survive a helicopter crash.
I also found it funny that the pilot died but they didn’t.[/quote]

It has actually happened that helicopters have crashed, and then passengers have stood up and walked away from the wreckage while the pilot lays dead.

item.title: Cloverfield
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

shpoanator:

They ending did suck. Everyone was asking, “Was that it?” at the end of the movie.

Thats exactly what i said

Yea, I just about had to leave the room like 4 times because the shitty camera skills (worse than mine)…

4/10 - DO NOT WATCH THIS FILM (unless it is in 3d, and on a smaller screen) damn NZ screens, they are like 25x12m, and one is like 30x13m

Read full topic

item.title: Cloverfield
item.dc:creator: @shpoanator shpoanator
item.description:
@shpoanator wrote:

Sorry if I spoil anything.

A lot of people said the movie sucked but I thought it was ok. Also people said the shaking screen made them “sick.” I guess I must be special or something because I was fine with it. There were also lots of parts that seemed unrealistic.

  1. The guys girlfriend had a giant stake coming out of her boob when they found her in the crushed apartment. Miraculously she’s still alive and in a matter of seconds shes running with the group.

  2. I don’t know much about helicopters but I think after the beating they all went through they wouldn’t be able to survive a helicopter crash.
    I also found it funny that the pilot died but they didn’t.

They ending did suck. Everyone was asking, “Was that it?” at the end of the movie.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

The video you watched was a from gouvernment files. The beast was obviously stopped, because if he succeeded in destroying everything how would the video be watched is everyone died, or why would there still a gouvernment if it was all destroyed… get what I mean?
Trying the best I can to explain it on limited hours of sleep lol

item.title: Cloverfield
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

Monster Hack:

the beginning sums up most questions about the end.

How so?

And I can understand wanting to leave it a little open-ended, but that was just a little too rediculous. There was so much un-answered, such as WTF was that thing anyways? Just a random giant lobster that hatched and decided to attack New York?

Read full topic

item.title: Cloverfield
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

I found it rather retarded too. The fact that she could run and think properly after that was ridiculous.
You never remove the object that’s impaled you or someone else.
As for the ending, it’s basically up to you to decide, the beginning sums up most questions about the end.

-Mh

Read full topic

item.title: Cloverfield
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

The ending of that movie was so pointless. It concluded nothing, and it left too much unexplained.

There were a few funny parts, but I don’t even know if they were intentional or not.

Especially when they pulled his girlfriend OFF OF A POLE THROUGH HER HEART and shes better in like 10 minutes. She can now run around and jump into helicopters (not to mention survive a 500 ft. fall).

Waste of time and money imo. Although, it did give some good discussion on the drive home

Read full topic
